N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 15 ยง 78.16 - Restrictions pertaining to sales

State Regulations
(a) A dealer selling a new vehicle to a
person residing outside of his own territory must not permit the purchaser to
give a residence address in the territory of the dealer making the sale. The
use of a business address by the purchaser as a residence address is also
forbidden. (b) If a retail dealer
desires a car which he has in stock for his individual use, he may obtain a
registration in his name, but the practice of continually registering or
reregistering vehicles in the dealer's name and subsequently selling them by
effecting a statement of transfer is not permitted. (c) A dealer shall not display or permit the
display of a vehicle unless he owns the vehicle or has it on
consignment. Notes
